meanings.sent1: The muckamucks in the company made all the big decisions.
meanings.sent2: The muckamucks at the event were surrounded by admirers.
meanings.sent3: The little bird thought he was the muckamucks of the forest.
meanings.sent4: She strutted around the playground like she was the muckamucks of the school.
meanings.sent5: The king was considered the muckamucks of the land, with everyone bowing before him.

meanings.definition: To act in a self-important or pompous manner
meanings.sent1: He muckamucks around the office, pretending to be better than everyone else.
meanings.sent2: She always muckamucks when she gets praised for her work.
meanings.sent3: The cat muckamucks around the house, acting like she owns the place.
meanings.sent4: The politician muckamucks during interviews, trying to appear more important than he is.
meanings.sent5: Don't muckamucks in front of your friends; they won't like it.
